thread.title: Do or die: Arch-rivals Karachi, Lahore face off today
thread.title_full: Do or die: Arch-rivals Karachi, Lahore face off today

title: Do or die: Arch-rivals Karachi, Lahore face off today
text:
Web Desk Posted   
DUBAI: Lahore Qalandars will clash with archrivals Karachi Kings in Saturday’s first game at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium, in what could turn out to be a playoff decider. 
It’s a do or die match for Kings, who sit at the bottom of the table with just 4 points and need to win both of their remaining two matches to make it to the playoffs. 
If Qalandars win today against Kings, Brendon McCullum’s men will be through to the playoffs and Kings would be eliminated. A defeat today, however, won’t eliminate Qalandars, who are currently at number four with 6 points. 
If Kings win today but lose tomorrow’s match against Islamabad United, NRR would come into play and decide the fate of Kumar Sangakkara’s side. 
If Qalandars v Kings match is washed out today, and if Quetta Gladiators beat Peshawar Zalmi tonight and if Kings win tomorrow against Islamabad United, then Zalmi, Qalandars and Kings will be depending on their NRR to take them through. 
Quetta Gladiators and Islamabad United are already through to the playoffs. Head to head 
Lahore Qalandars clashed with Karachi Kings in the 8th match of PSL on Feb 16 and won the match by 7 runs. That match was dominated by young Qalandar Fakhar Zaman, who scored a bold 56 runs off 36 balls and bagged the Man of the Match award. Squads 
Lahore Qalandars: Brendon McCullum (captain), Sunil Narine, Umar Akmal, Yasir Shah, Sohail Tanvir, Cameron Delport, Mohammad Rizwan, Azhar Ali, Zafar Gohar, Grant Elliot, Fakhar Zaman, Bilawal Bhatti, Ghulam Mudassar, Aamir Yamin, Usman Qadir, Saif Badar, Jason Roy, Chris Green, James Franklin, Muhammad Irfan Jr 
Karachi Kings: Kumar Sangakkara (captain), Shoaib Malik, Chris Gayle, Babar Azam, Ravi Bopara, Imad Wasim, Mohammad Amir, Saifullah Bangash, Shahzaib Hasan, Sohail Khan, Kieron Pollard, Ryan Mclaren, Khurram Manzoor, Kashif Bhatti, Abrar Ahmed, Usama Mir, Mahela Jayawardene, Rahat Ali, Hasan Mohsin, Amad Alam More Stories From PSL
